decks.notes: This deck focuses on using various cards to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures, then bring them back onto the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent. Cards like Analyze the Pollen and Bringer of the Last Gift help to fill the graveyard, while cards like Overlord of the Balemurk and Harvester of Misery can be brought back from the graveyard for a devastating effect. The deck also includes some control elements like Bitter Triumph and Willowrush Verge to help stay alive until the combo can be assembled. Overall, the strategy revolves around reanimating creatures to dominate the battlefield.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and instant damage spells to quickly overwhelm and defeat the opponent. With a mix of efficient creatures and burn spells, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain that pressure throughout the game. The mana base is optimized for quick and consistent plays, while key cards like Torch the Tower and Duelist of the Mind serve as the main sources of damage and control. The goal is to maintain a fast pace and win the game before the opponent can establish their own game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using low-cost spells and creatures, while also maintaining board presence with powerful creatures like Nova Hellkite and Burnout Bashtronaut. By efficiently using resources like Burst Lightning, Lightning Strike, and Shock, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can set up their own strategy. With a mix of burn spells, efficient creatures, and land destruction, this deck excels at applying pressure and closing out games swiftly.

The main focus of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence with efficient creatures and use spells like Earthbender Ascension and Conduit Pylons to ramp up mana and overwhelm opponents. By utilizing cards like Icetill Explorer and Llanowar Elves to accelerate mana production, along with powerful cards like Colossal Rattlewurm and Sazh's Chocobo, this deck aims to put pressure on opponents early and maintain a steady stream of threats to close out games quickly. Additionally, cards like Esper Origins and Mightform Harmonizer provide additional versatility and utility to adapt to different matchups.

This deck focuses on aggressively maintaining control of the board through a mix of powerful creatures and disruptive spells. By combining aggressive creatures like Cecil, Dark Knight and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares with control elements like Spell Pierce and Heartless Act, the deck aims to pressure opponents while disrupting their game plan. The inclusion of cards like Gloomlake Verge and Multiversal Passage provides flexibility and ensures consistent mana production. Overall, the deck seeks to control the game tempo and overwhelm opponents through a combination of aggression and disruption.

The deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Badgermole Cub and Deep-Cavern Bat to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Ouroboroid and Earthbender Ascension, it aims to gain a tempo advantage and maintain board control. The inclusion of removal spells like Stab and Bitter Triumph helps to deal with opposing threats, while cards like Sentinel of the Nameless City provide additional utility. The deck also includes land ramp with Llanowar Elves and Fabled Passage to ensure consistent mana production for its powerful creatures and spells.

The main concept of this Izzet Control deck revolves around card advantage and resource management. By using cards like Accumulate Wisdom, Artist's Talent, and Monument to Endurance, the player can draw cards, control the board, and generate value over time. The deck also includes a mix of removal spells and powerful threats like Ral, Crackling Wit to help control the game and win through a combination of burn spells and efficient creature removal. The overall strategy focuses on outlasting the opponent and out-valuing them to secure victory.

The main concept of this UW Control deck is to establish board control and disrupt the opponent's game plan using a combination of removal spells, enchantments, and artifacts. Authority of the Consuls helps to slow down aggressive strategies, while Simulacrum Synthesizer and other artifacts provide additional value and versatility. Cards like Perilous Snare and Demolition Field can deal with threats efficiently, while Cryogen Relic and Split Up offer card advantage. The deck also includes cards like Temple of Enlightenment and Multiversal Passage for mana fixing and consistency. Overall, the focus is on controlling the game and outlasting the opponent.

The main concept of the deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells while maintaining card advantage through abilities like Enduring Curiosity and Tishana's Tidebinder. The deck also utilizes a combination of creatures that can control the board and deal damage efficiently, such as Spyglass Siren and Floodpits Drowner. The inclusion of cards like Cecil, Dark Knight and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares adds to the deck's aggressive nature, making it difficult for the opponent to stabilize and mount a defense.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a combination of Dimir creatures and spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It includes a mix of cheap creatures for early pressure and removal spells to deal with threats. The deck also utilizes card draw and mana fixing to maintain advantage and ensure consistency in playing out its game plan. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly while maintaining control of the battlefield.

The main concept of this deck is to control the opponent's board and resources using a combination of spell cards and creatures. By utilizing cards like Abandon Attachments, Combustion Technique, and Firebending Lesson, the player attempts to disrupt their opponent's strategy while building up their own board presence with creatures like Gran-Gran and Boomerang Basics. Multiversal Passage and Monument to Endurance provide options for mana ramp and card advantage, while cards like Artist's Talent and Stormchaser's Talent offer additional control and card draw options. The deck aims to outlast the opponent while steadily gaining advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent quickly with a combination of flying creatures and efficient spells. By utilizing the Azorius colors and focusing on aggressive plays, you aim to control the board and chip away at your opponent's life total. With a mix of creature buffs, card draw, and mana acceleration, you can maintain pressure on your opponent and secure victory before they have a chance to stabilize. This deck is designed to be fast-paced and relentless, putting your opponent on the back foot from the start.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of removal spells, bounce effects, and card draw. By utilizing Fear of Isolation and Grim Bauble for control, along with Stock Up for card advantage, the player can disrupt their opponent's game plan while advancing their own. Entity Tracker and Shoot the Sheriff provide targeted removal, while Nowhere to Run and Boomerang Basics offer flexibility in handling threats. The inclusion of Tinybones Joins Up and Strategic Betrayal allows for additional card advantage and disruption, solidifying the deck's control strategy.

The main focus of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creature cards while also utilizing card draw and mana fixing to maintain a consistent tempo. The deck includes a mix of efficient creatures and support cards to quickly build a strong board presence and apply pressure on the opponent. By combining aggressive creatures with mana ramp and removal options, the deck aims to establish control of the battlefield and swiftly secure a victory through fast and relentless attacks.

The main concept of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of powerful creatures and support cards. The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Llanowar Elves and Fabled Passage, while also utilizing cards like Colossal Rattlewurm and Sazh's Chocobo to pressure the opponent. Additionally, cards like Earthbender Ascension and Mightform Harmonizer help to boost the strength of the deck's creatures, allowing for fast and aggressive gameplay. The main goal is to establish a strong board presence early on and maintain pressure throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to achieve a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing red creatures and spells to deal damage quickly to the opponent. The deck includes cards that enhance the power of your creatures, such as Might of the Meek and Bulk Up, as well as cards that allow for direct damage to the opponent, like Dreadmaw's Ire and Slickshot Show-Off. Leyline of Resonance helps to maintain card advantage while Emberheart Challenger and Hired Claw provide strong attackers. Overall, the strategy revolves around overwhelming the opponent with a relentless assault.
